argument.name: flag
argument.description: Optional. Default = 1. Flag determines which record is the "previous" record.

item.name: 1 = Previous record is the record that was current immediately prior to going into Enter mode.
2 = Last physical record in the table.
3 = Logical record in the table based on the current index/query.
Browses (for <OBJECT> use either the <BROWSE> pointer or the name of the browse)
Forms (for <OBJECT> use either the <FORM> pointer or the name of the form)

section.description: The <OBJECT>.COPY_PREV_RECORD() method copies values from the previous record into the current record. The layout must be in Enter mode. Limitations: Desktop applications only.

section.title: Example
section.description: This button on a form copies values from the previous record into the current record that is being entered:

page.original:
&ltOBJECT>.COPY_PREV_RECORD() Syntax &ltOBJECT>.COPY_PREV_RECORD( Flag as N ) ArgumentDescription FlagOptional. Default = 1. Flag determines which record is the "previous" record.
1 = Previous record is the record that was current immediately prior to going into Enter mode.
2 = Last physical record in the table.
3 = Logical record in the table based on the current index/query.
Description The &ltOBJECT>.COPY_PREV_RECORD() method applies to:
Browses (for &ltOBJECT> use either the &ltBROWSE> pointer or the name of the browse)
Forms (for &ltOBJECT> use either the &ltFORM> pointer or the name of the form) The &ltOBJECT>.COPY_PREV_RECORD() method copies values from the previous record into the current record. The layout must be in Enter mode. Limitations Desktop applications only. Example This button on a form copies values from the previous record into the current record that is being entered: topparent.copy_prev_record()
See Also Form Functions and Methods, Browse Functions and Methods
